resources.string:
MockGeoFix makes your phone support \"geo fix\" and \"geo nmea\" commands (compatible with the android emulator commands).

\"Mock Locations\" must be enabled in developer options.
Also make sure to disable all location sources except "GPS satellites" in \"Location Sources\" settings. (MockGeoFix mocks a GPS provider.)

Telnet to port %s using one of the IPs above and enter a geo command. For example:
geo fix -121.45356 46.51119 4392
\"Allow mock location\" must be enabled for MockGeoFix to work correctly. Open \"Developer options\"?
Failed to open \"Developer options\". You are probably running too old Android. You have to open \"Developer options\" manually.
GPS location provider should be enabled and all other providers should be disabled for MockGeoFix to work properly. Open \"Location Sources\" settings?
Failed to open \"Location Sources\". You have to open \"Location Sources\" settings manually.
Warning: Location provider \"%s\" is enabled. This provider might collide with MockGeoFix location updates.

string.name: require_password_summary
string.b:
WARNING: Requiring password breaks compatibility with tools depending on the standard android emulator geo command behaviour.


Password is provided using the following telnet command: 
PASSWORD <password> 
Example: PASSWORD blue-taco

resources.string: That\'s an invalid port number. Port must be a number between 0 and 65535.
Binding error. Address/port already in use.
Binding error. Permission denied. (You should use port number >=1024.)
Mock Location Provider could not be created. Is \"Allow mock locations\" enabled in \"Developer options\"?
Note: This change won\'t take effect until you restart the service.
